snippet: Gov. Chris Christie, whose aides and appointees apparently engineered a traffic nightmare as political payback, sought to change the subject in his State of the State speech.
abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie scrambles to regain his political footing and delivers a high-stakes State of the State address; speech mixes expressions of contrition, defiant assertion that his troubles are no excuse for inaction and a demand for bipartisanship; still there is little sign that his administration’s widening scandal over lane closings at the George Washington Bridge is abating

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and MARC SANTORA

lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie, whose aides and appointees apparently engineered a traffic nightmare as political payback, sought to change the subject in his State of the State speech.

headline.main: No Bluster as Christie Moves From Scandal to His Agenda
headline.print_headline: No Bluster as Christie Moves From Scandal to His Agenda
